{"abstract": "By helping people bypass exorbitant texting fees charged by mobile carriers, WhatsApp saved heavy users of texting a lot of money. There\u2019s a larger lesson here for all telecom carriers.", "web_url": "https://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2014/02/20/the-other-big-winner-in-the-whatsapp-deal-your-wallet/", "snippet": "By helping people bypass exorbitant texting fees charged by mobile carriers, WhatsApp saved heavy users of texting a lot of money. There\u2019s a larger lesson here for all telecom carriers.", "lead_paragraph": " Facebook\u2019s acquisition of WhatsApp for at least $16 billion has minted dozens of new millionaires and billionaires this week, but there was another big winner in the deal: Parents and their teenage children, who have most likely saved hundreds or even thousands of dollars in texting fees thanks to the hugely popular messaging app, and will continue to do so after the deal.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "5", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [{"rank": 0, "subtype": "xlarge", {"abstract": "The excess profits companies can extract from their customers when they face little or no competition \u2014 known to economists as \u201crents\u201d \u2014 may be deepening income inequality, experts argue.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/05/28/business/economy/concentrated-markets-take-big-toll-on-economy.html", "snippet": "The excess profits companies can extract from their customers when they face little or no competition \u2014 known to economists as \u201crents\u201d \u2014 may be deepening income inequality, experts argue.", "lead_paragraph": "Nobody believes AT&T\u2019s $48 billion shot at buying DirecTV will be the last attempt by the nation\u2019s communications leviathans to get even bigger. {"abstract": "SugarString ran afoul of the public when The DailyDot reported in October that an editor recruiting journalists was warning them that the site would forbid reporting on \u201cspying and net neutrality.\u201d", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/04/business/media/verizon-shuts-down-sugarstring-technology-site.html", "snippet": "SugarString ran afoul of the public when The DailyDot reported in October that an editor recruiting journalists was warning them that the site would forbid reporting on \u201cspying and net neutrality.\u201d", "lead_paragraph": "As journalism and corporate promotion merge, there have been many interesting experiments. {"abstract": "As government bond yields worldwide get pushed down, corporate debt issuers edging toward junk status are in a sweet spot.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/05/business/dealbook/actaviss-bond-sale-demonstrates-investor-hunger-for-high-yield-debt.html", "snippet": "As government bond yields worldwide get pushed down, corporate debt issuers edging toward junk status are in a sweet spot.", "lead_paragraph": "Actavis is showcasing the value of being barely investment grade. The company, a drug maker that has been making many acquisitions, attracted huge demand this week for $21 billion of bonds it is selling at a mere notch above junk status. They yield less than a bigger and higher-rated debt issue that Verizon did in 2013. Buyers of top-tier debt can\u2019t help but keep looking further downward.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Actavis\u2019s Bond Sale Demonstrates Investor Hunger for High-Yield Debt", "kicker": "Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "organizations", "value": "Actavis PLC", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "ALLERGAN INC", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Stocks and Bonds", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2015-03-04T17:12:41+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "DealBook", "byline": {"original": "By Robert Cyran", "person": [{"firstname": "Robert", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Cyran", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/f1bedf69-a34c-5e6e-a43a-91ce49090c2a", "word_count": 374, "uri": "nyt://article/f1bedf69-a34c-5e6e-a43a-91ce49090c2a"}

{"abstract": "Disney and Fox said they would not run a commercial for FiOS\u2019s new cable package on some of their channels.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/24/business/media/resistance-to-verizon-fios-promotion.html", "snippet": "Disney and Fox said they would not run a commercial for FiOS\u2019s new cable package on some of their channels.", "lead_paragraph": "Disney and Fox took another swipe at Verizon on Thursday, informing the telecommunications company that they would not run a commercial for FiOS\u2019s new cable package on some of their channels. {"abstract": "Shareholders should be willing to sell near an offer price rather than wait to see a merger close", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/08/business/dealbook/investors-remorse-follows-buyers-remorse-as-big-deals-fall-apart.html", "snippet": "Shareholders should be willing to sell near an offer price rather than wait to see a merger close", "lead_paragraph": "A spate of corporate deal remorse has left investors regretful, too. Abbott Laboratories on Wednesday cited \u201cmaterial adverse events\u201d in a legal bid to end its $5.8 billion takeover of the medical test maker Alere. Similar tensions have arisen in mergers involving Yahoo, Williams and Cigna. {"abstract": "A security researcher says hackers are offering records of more than 1 billion users, but as with the company\u2019s stock, the price is dropping.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/15/technology/hacked-yahoo-data-for-sale-dark-web.html", "snippet": "A security researcher says hackers are offering records of more than 1 billion users, but as with the company\u2019s stock, the price is dropping.", "lead_paragraph": "SAN FRANCISCO \u2014 Some time around August 2013, hackers penetrated the email system of Yahoo, one of the world\u2019s largest and oldest providers of free email services.
